name: Reykjavik
description: Reykjavik is the capital and largest city of Iceland. It is located in southwestern Iceland, on the southern shore of Faxaflói bay.

dayTrips.title: The Golden Circle
dayTrips.description: Easy, flat walking paths right between tectonic plates and geysers.

dayTrips.title: Reykjadalur
dayTrips.description: A moderate valley hike ending in a naturally warm river you can bathe in.

dayTrips.title: City Center
dayTrips.description: Walk around Tjörnin (city pond) and the Harpa Concert Hall interactive play areas.

name: Amsterdam
description: Amsterdam is the capital and most populous city of the Netherlands. It is known for its artistic heritage, elaborate canal system and narrow houses with gabled facades.

dayTrips.title: Zandvoort aan Zee
dayTrips.description: 30-min train to the coast for wide beaches and easy dune walks.

dayTrips.title: Zaanse Schans
dayTrips.description: Short trip north for historic windmills and live demonstrations.

dayTrips.title: Vondelpark & Jordaan
dayTrips.description: Massive car-free park walking and picturesque canal streets.

name: Frankfurt
description: Frankfurt, a central German city on the river Main, is a major financial hub that's home to the European Central Bank. It's the birthplace of famed writer Johann Wolfgang von Goethe.

dayTrips.title: The Rhine Valley
dayTrips.description: Short train to riverboats, dotted with hillside castle ruins.

dayTrips.title: Taunus Nature Park
dayTrips.description: Gentile, heavily wooded trails ending at a reconstructed Roman fort.

dayTrips.title: Main River Promenade
dayTrips.description: Flat, tree-lined walking paths starting right from the old town square.
